events.description: The release of UK house price data for January 2026 showing a 1% year-on-year increase.

facts.fact_text: UK house prices rose 1% year-on-year in January 2026.

evidences.evidence_text: The Halifax House Price Index showed UK house prices rose 1% year-on-year in January 2026

facts.fact_text: The average UK home price reached £300,077, surpassing £300,000 for the first time.

evidences.evidence_text: The average UK home surpassed £300,000 for the first time, reaching £300,077.

facts.fact_text: Monthly house prices rose 0.7% in January, exceeding the expected 0.1% growth.

evidences.evidence_text: On a monthly basis, prices rose 0.7%, more than the expected 0.1% growth

facts.fact_text: Northern Ireland recorded the highest regional growth at 5.9%.

evidences.evidence_text: Regionally, Northern Ireland led growth at 5.9%

claims.claim_text: The UK housing market entered 2026 on a steady footing.
claims.author: Amanda Bryden

evidences.evidence_text: Amanda Bryden, Head of Mortgages at Halifax, said the market entered 2026 on a steady footing

claims.claim_text: UK house prices are expected to increase by 1% to 3% in 2026.
claims.author: Halifax

evidences.evidence_text: Halifax expects prices to edge up 1%–3% in 2026.

claims.claim_text: Price declines in Southern regions reflect higher borrowing costs and affordability pressures.
claims.author: Halifax

evidences.evidence_text: Southern regions... saw annual declines of over 1%, reflecting higher borrowing costs and affordability pressures.

evidence.evidence_text: Stronger wage growth and more mortgage deals below 4% are supporting buyers
Stronger wage growth and more mortgage deals below 4% are supporting buyers
Southern regions... saw annual declines of over 1%, reflecting higher borrowing costs and affordability pressures.
